block.p: The Japan Securities Dealers Association said yesterday that the securities industry would contribute a total 21 billion yen ($23 million) to a fund of 1 trillion yen ($920 million), which will help cover losses resulting from the dissolution of seven debt-laden housing loan companies.

Japan's four major securities houses will each contribute 5 billion yen, while 11 second-tier houses, which provided capital to the Daichi Housing Finance Company and the Nippon Housing Loan Company, will contribute a total of 1 billion yen, said Kaname Seki, a deputy chairman of the association. Japan's Finance Ministry is reported to have asked Japan's 10 leading commercial banks to contribute a total of 506 billion yen.
